column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Learners can decide what parts of the course to access, the order, and the pace

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Learners can control their learning activities

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Learning units and modules are self-contained enough that learners can take them out of sequence without becoming confused

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Navigation and access mechanisms (menus, course maps, indexes, etc.) are sufficient that learners can find specific items of content

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The web course allows the learner to leave whenever desired but easily return to the closest logical point in the course

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The layout of the web course speaks for itself so that the extensive consultation of online help or other documentation does not interfere with learning and/or finding the desired information

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Learners can get started taking the web course (locate it, install plug-ins, register, access starting page) using only online assistance

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: It is clear what learners would do if they get stuck or have questions

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Learners can predict the general result of clicking on each button or link

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The pages and other components of the web course download quickly

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The web course is easy to install, uninstall, and launch

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The web course is free from technical problems

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Accommodation is made for users who turn off graphic information displays in their browser

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Absence of graphics does not dilute the value of the information

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Pages are displayed in such a way that those who choose to change default display characteristics to accommodate visual impairments or preferences may do so without loss of information

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Terminology of the functions is used consistently throughout the web course

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The fonts, colors, and sizes are consistent throughout the web course

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The web course maintains an appropriate level of consistency in its design from one part of the course to another

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The most important information on the screen is placed in areas most likely to attract the learner's attention

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The course is attractive and appealing to the learner's senses

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Text and graphics are legible

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Fonts (style, color, saturation) are easy to read in both on-screen and printed versions

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The web course does not provide too many long sections of text to read without meaningful interactions

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Learners are given the opportunity to practice ideas and skills immediately after they are presented

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Practice activities exercise knowledge and skills in a way that prepares learners to apply learning to their jobs

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The web course engages learners in tasks that are closely aligned with that eLearning goals and objectives

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The web course uses games, simulations, role-playing activities, and case studies to gain the attention, sustain the interest, and maintain motivation of learner

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Content is organized in an appropriate sequence and in small modules for flexible learning

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The material in the course is accurate and current

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The course covers the subject in sufficient breadth and depth to meet the learning objectives

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Resources are provided in a manner that replicates as closely as possible their availability and use in the real world

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Text blocks are written in minimalist style: compact, yet useful

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The web course provides access to a range of resources (web links, case studies, simulations, problems, examples) appropriate to the learning context

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Vocabulary and terminology used are appropriate for the learners

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Abstract concepts (principles, formulas, rules, etc.) are illustrated with concrete, specific examples

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: All units/modules in the web course include an overview and a summary

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Learners are made aware of learning objective for each unit/module of the web course

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Graphics and multimedia assist in noticing and learning critical content rather than merely entertaining or possible distracting learners

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Graphics (illustrations, photographs, graphs, diagrams, etc.) are used appropriately; for example, to communicate visual and spatial concept

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Media (text, images, animations, etc.) included have a strong connection to the objectives and design of the courses

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The web course provides opportunities and support for learning through interaction with others through discussion or other collaborative activities

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: It is clear to the learner what is to be accomplished and what will be gained from its use

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The web course is designed with activities that are both individual and group based

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The web course provides the learners opportunities to reflect

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The web course provides learners with opportunities to access extended feedback from instructors, experts, peers, or others through e-mail or other internet communications

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Feedback given at any specific time is tailored to the content being studied, problem being solved, or task being completed by the learner

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The web course provides opportunities for self-assessments that advance learner achievement

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Wherever appropriate, higher order assessments are (analysis, synthesis, and evaluation) provided rather than lower order assessments (recall and recognition)

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: Posttests and other assessments adequately measure accomplishment of the learning objectives

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The online help or documentation is written clearly

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The online help is screen or context specific

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The web course offers tools (taking notes, job aids, resources, glossary, etc.) that support learning

column2: Usability Evaluation Method for e-Learning Applications: Beyond Functional Usability
column6: The web course provides support for learner activities to allow working within existing competence while encountering meaningful chunks of knowledge

column2: Measuring Web Usability Using Item Response Theory
column6: When opening the homepage, are there no open pop-ups?

column2: Measuring Web Usability Using Item Response Theory
column6: Does the homepage present the objective of the website without the use of scroll?

column2: Measuring Web Usability Using Item Response Theory

column2: UWIS (Usability Assessment and Design of Web-Based Information Systems)
